attn_node.name: EQ_QME_FIR
attn_node.bit: PPE halted due to an error, which is an OR the 4 signals captured in ERR(0:3). This indication is intended to be reported to the OCC complex as an
PPE asserted debug trigger. Connected to PPEDBG[FIR_TRIGGER]. May be used by QME hcode to indicate an error to PRD or to induce a checkstop for
Used for TBD testing or workarounds
PPE asserted a watchdog timeout condition.
QME hardware detected its own timeout on the PCB Slave interface and forced a return code of 0x7. Note: uses the Watchdog TSEL minus 2 bits (watchdog
Either the Block Copy Engine or QME PPE direct access received an error from the Fabric. A BCE error also causes an interrupt to the QME PPE, if it
SRAM Uncorrectable Error.
SRAM Correctable Error. QME received corrected data, but SRAM content is bad until next scrub to that line. (Should be masked in the product;
Resonant Clock Table array Parity Error.
Hcode wrote the PIG to request a PCB interrupt before its previously requested interrupt had been completed (meaning PIG[PENDING_SOURCE(0)] = 1 OR
Scrub timer tick occurred when scrub is still pending (hardware defect or severe configuration error). Unless the FIT timer is set to smaller than 16
Refer to ERR bits of the same name to see which Core instance.
Refer to ERR bits of the same name to see which Core instance.
PGPE Heartbeat Lost indication from a hardware deadman timer controlled by QHB. Intended to be reported as an interrupt to QME via action 10.
Notification that BCE has not made forward progress in the time period corresponding to two scrub timer pulses (regardless of scrub enable). The BCE
Resclk TARGET_PSTATE Change Protocol Error. PGPE code bug.
PCB Network or Endpoint Reset occurred when QME was not halted. This should never occur during runtime (for lab debug use only) and MAY result in loss
Firmware cleared their Special Wakeup request in SPWU_{OTR|FSP|OCC|HYP}[ SPECIAL_WKUP_REQ] before the SPECIAL_WKUP_DONE was set.
Indicates a window condition occurred where one firmware component set a new special wakeup right after a different firmware component cleared the
Any of the Core External Interrupt wakeup sources (os, hyp, msgsnd, msgsndu) are present but disabled by the threads PECE (or UDEE) when it is in Stop
Any of the Core External Interrupts (os, hyp, msgsnd, msgsndu) are present but the chiplet is deconfigured (based on the partial good region enable
Notification that RS4 engine has not made forward progress in the time period corresponding to two watchdog timer pulses (regardless of PPE watchdog
Data hang was detected in the powerbus logic, caused by a powerbus read command waiting for data that is lost.
The PPE tried to write a protected address as defined by the SWPR[n] register
DTC Sequencer read a UE from SRAM, causing it to abort its current sequence and disable itself in QMCR.
Correctable error detected on incoming data for a PowerBus read.
UE Detected on incoming data for a PowerBus read.
SUE Detected on incoming data for a PowerBus read.
A Powerbus Request address has hit an invalid entry in the TOPOLOGY XLATE TABLE [PBTXTR] REGISTER. This is an unrecoverable error indicating the
Parity error detected on a powerbus tag. Includes combined response ATAG/TTAG parity error as well as a data transaction RTAG parity error.
Code attempted to write the PIG register when the previous request was still pending i.e. PIG.PENDING_SOURCE(0)=1.
Set based on the OR of three ERR[LOCAL_ACCESS_*_ERR] bits.
CE detected on a read to the SSA located in the QME powerbus routing logic.
UE detected on a read to the SSA located in the QME powerbus routing logic.
Implemented but not used. Input tied to 0.
Implemented but not used. Input tied to 0.
